title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must show appropriate work in order to receive each point.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must include both a correct statement and explanation in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that foreign importers of electric vehicles will buy fewer electric vehicles from Fehran in 2012 and/or does not explain that electric vehicles in Fehran are relatively more expensive as a result of the increase in the price level.

The response states that foreign importers of electric vehicles will buy fewer electric vehicles from Fehran in 2012 and explains that electric vehicles in Fehran are relatively more expensive as a result of the increase in the price level.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must include both a correct statement and explanation in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that the standard of living of the average person in Fehran stayed the same and/or does not explain that real GDP MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4raiaabseacaqGqbaaaa@3858@ per capita did not change from 2011 to 2012 or that it stayed at $1,500.

The response states that the standard of living of the average person in Fehran stayed the same and explains that real GDP MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4raiaabseacaqGqbaaaa@3858@ per capita did not change from 2011 to 2012 or that it stayed at $1,500.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must include both a correct statement and explanation in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that Fehran’s national debt will increase and/or does not explain that government outlays are greater than taxes and a government adds to the national debt when it runs a budget deficit.
The response states that Fehran’s national debt will increase and explains that government outlays are greater than taxes and a government adds to the national debt when it runs a budget deficit.
